page.title: 04History of Ringmer - 2
page.content: A memorial on the floor of the Church commemorates the "truly pious and ingenious daughter of{Sir John Stapely of the Broil Place" who bequeathed Â£100 for the instruction of the children of Ringmer in letters and needlework. This was the foundation of{The Stapely Charity.}Income from the charity still goes into the Primary School Prize Fund. A famous Ringmer inhabitant was{ {Timothy Tortoise}who lived during the eighteenth century with the vicar,{ {Henry Snooke}and his wife{Rebecca}at {Delves House.}He then passed into the ownership of Rebecca's nephew, the naturalist{Gilbert White}of Selborne and figures prominently in his{ {"Natural History of Selborne".} Timothy's carapace is now in the Natural History Museum in London.
